title: HAR70+
description: The Human Activity Recognition 70+ (HAR70+) dataset is a professionally-annotated dataset containing 18 fit-to-frail older-adult subjects (70-95 years old) wearing two 3-axial accelerometers for around 40 minutes during a semi-structured free-living protocol. The sensors were attached to the right thigh and lower back. The purpose was to train machine learning models for human activity recognition on professionally-annotated accelerometer data of fit-to-frail older adults. Source: https://archive.ics.uci.edu/dataset/780/har70

target.name: label
target.description: Activity performed by the subject (1: walking  3: shuffling 4: stairs (ascending) 5: stairs (descending) 6: standing 7: sitting	8: lying)

features.name: back_x
features.description: acceleration of back sensor in x-direction (down) in the unit g

features.name: back_y
features.description: acceleration of back sensor in y-direction (left) in the unit g

features.name: back_z
features.description: acceleration of back sensor in z-direction (forward) in the unit g

features.name: thigh_x
features.description: acceleration of thigh sensor in x-direction (down) in the unit g

features.name: thigh_y
features.description: acceleration of thigh sensor in y-direction (left) in the unit g

features.name: thigh_z
features.description: acceleration of thigh sensor in z-direction (forward) in the unit g
